creator: manuel-asf@mausz.at
text:
Created attachment 31916
patch

We're in the progress of moving from mod_fastcgi to mod_proxy_fcgi on our PHP-FPM setups and noticed that http authentication won't work anymore.

The main reason for this is the "Authorization"-header won't get passed to the fcgi app, unless explicitly set. e.g. using SetEnvIf Authorization "(.*)" HTTP_AUTHORIZATION=$1

Since both fcgi modules, mod_fastcgi and mod_fcgid, support a much easier "pass header"-directive I decided to add this to mod_proxy_fcgi as well.

Most code is copied from mod_fcgid. The legacy behavior ist left out right away.
Please see http://httpd.apache.org/mod_fcgid/mod/mod_fcgid.html#fcgidpassheader for more information.

Patch is attached.

text:
A more global solution has been committed to httpd trunk (r1642847).  This solution provides a core directive CGIPassAuth On|Off to control the feature on behalf of most modules which pass requests to scripts and use CGI variables to encode HTTP headers.  The AuthConfig override controls whether or not it can be set in .htaccess.

I'll propose it for merging back to the 2.4.x branch after others have had a chance to comment.
